results.definition: a restraint incorporated into the ignition switch to prevent the use of a vehicle by persons who do not have the key
place in a place where something cannot be removed or someone cannot escape
examples: The parents locked her daughter up for the weekend
She locked her jewels in the safe

results.definition: enclosure consisting of a section of canal that can be closed to control the water level; used to raise or lower vessels that pass through it

examples: He locked his hands around her neck

results.definition: a strand or cluster of hair
become engaged or intermeshed with one another
a fastener fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed
a mechanism that detonates the charge of a gun
any wrestling hold in which some part of the opponent's body is twisted or pressured

examples: The therapist noticed that the patient's knees tended to lock in this exercise

results.definition: build locks in order to facilitate the navigation of vessels

examples: lock the bike to the fence
He was locked in a laughing fit

results.definition: pass by means through a lock in a waterway
